author: thomas
post: Personally I think the Vignon markings are absurd. How artists could get detailed features such as these out of the faint and indistinct Shroud image is beyond me. That’s not to say the Shroud image could not have influenced this artistic tradition in a more general manner. General features such as the facial shape (long face, long nose), hair length, and facial hair features are shared between the two. Although the artistic tradition could easily have developed in the way it did without the shroud too..
